thread.section_title: Louisville News, Sports, Business | The Courier-Journal
thread.title: S. Indiana to see I-65 traffic shift by Thursday morning
thread.title_full: S. Indiana to see I-65 traffic shift by Thursday morning

author: courier-journal.com
title: S. Indiana to see I-65 traffic shift by Thursday morning
text:
Another major traffic change in connection with the Ohio River Bridges Project is taking effect, this time affecting motorists on Interstate 65 in Southern Indiana.
"Drivers traveling on I-65 South in Southern Indiana need to prepare for a significant traffic change," highway officials said in a release Tuesday morning.
Crews with Walsh Construction, the contractor building the downtown bridge parallel to the Kennedy, have completed the necessary work to shift I-65 South traffic to new lanes of I-65 North. The shift is expected to happen overnight Wednesday, with two lanes of southbound traffic moved east to the new roadway by early Thursday, the release said.
The move means both southbound and northbound traffic on I-65 – two lanes of traffic in each direction – will be using new lanes of I-65 North from Browns Station Way to the Kennedy Bridge. The shift means the split configuration, in place on I-65 South since last October, will be coming to an end.
THE COURIER-JOURNAL
Bridge work having desired impact of spurring development, especially in Southern Indiana
Northbound traffic started using the new lanes of I-65 this summer. Significant work had to be completed in the median, including demolition work and installing barrier wall, to move southbound traffic to its new position.
The traffic switch will give crews the room they need to build new lanes of I-65 South that will connect to the revamped Kennedy Bridge. Demolition of the old lanes of I-65 South will begin immediately. The process of building new roadway will continue through most of 2016.
I-65 North and I-65 South will continue to be reduced from three through lanes of traffic to two from the Kennedy Bridge to Brown’s Station Way. The lane reductions extend for nearly 1 ½ miles and are expected to continue through late 2016, when the project nears completion.
Both directions of I-65 traffic had been using the southbound lanes of I-65 since early October 2014. That had allowed crews to demolish the old lanes of I-65 North and build new roadway to connect with the new cable-stayed bridge. The new bridge is expected to open to two-way traffic by January.
The new Downtown bridge will eventually carry six lanes of northbound traffic and the Kennedy Bridge will carry six lanes of southbound traffic. The project is scheduled for completion in December 2016.
THE COURIER-JOURNAL
Progress on bridges project applauded
The highway officials and Downtown Crossing crews outlined this schedule:
•In mid-October, traffic from the 10th Street ramp in Southern Indiana to I-65 South will move over to a new roadway (new lanes of I-65 NB).
•In mid-November, the ramp from U.S. 31 South to Court Avenue – providing direct access to the Clark Memorial Bridge – will reopen to traffic.
•Late this year, the date is uncertain, the flyover ramp from U.S. 31 North to I-65 North is scheduled to open to traffic, allowing drivers crossing the Clark Bridge direct access to I-65 North.
Find more information on the Ohio River Bridges Project at www.kyinbridges.com .
